alert.note: Alert for Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 12 at 2:23PM CDT until October 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL PHELPS...WEST CENTRAL BUFFALO AND SOUTHEASTERN DAWSON COUNTIES... At 223 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Overton, or 12 miles southeast of Lexington, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Overton around 230 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 247 and 253. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
